metadata.title: Introduction to FOSSDA and Open Source
metadata.synopsis: Heather Meeker introduces the FOSSDA digital archive, emphasizing the profound impact of open source software. She highlights how the movement was driven by individuals rather than governments or corporations.
metadata.keywords: open source, FOSSDA, software movement, digital archive

metadata.title: The Origins and Growth of Open Source
metadata.synopsis: Open source began as an effort to make software more accessible. Meeker explains how open-source software is now an integral part of daily life, thanks to the dedication of early contributors.
metadata.keywords: open source, software access, community, technology impact

metadata.title: Capturing Personal Stories of Open Source Pioneers
metadata.synopsis: Meeker discusses the importance of documenting the personal stories behind the open-source movement. She hopes these stories will help future generations understand its origins and significance.
metadata.keywords: oral history, open source pioneers, movement documentation

metadata.title: Heather Meeker's Personal Journey into Technology
metadata.synopsis: Meeker shares her background as a computer programmer in the 1980s, working with compiled BASIC. She reflects on how software development was different back then and how she entered the field without formal education in programming.
metadata.keywords: Heather Meeker, programming, BASIC, 1980s, software industry

metadata.title: Transition from Programming to Law
metadata.synopsis: Meeker describes her shift from programming to law, discovering the emerging field of software licensing. She recalls how open-source licenses were initially misunderstood by legal professionals.
metadata.keywords: career transition, software licensing, law, open source licenses

metadata.title: Pioneering Open Source Legal Work
metadata.synopsis: Faced with skepticism about open source, Meeker took an innovative approach by developing legal frameworks for it. She likens legal work to solving complex puzzles, much like programming.
metadata.keywords: legal challenges, software licenses, open source law, problem-solving

metadata.title: Passion for Open Source and Closing Remarks
metadata.synopsis: Meeker reflects on her fulfilling career in open-source law and the intellectual engagement it provides. She encourages listeners to explore the archive and consider how individuals can drive global change.
metadata.keywords: career fulfillment, open source advocacy, storytelling, inspiration
